intro: Baccaurea bhaswatii, commonly known as the Bhaswatii date palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and clusters of small, edible fruits. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that develop into fleshy, sweet fruits resembling dates. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated in various parts of South Asia.
